sen.j: 線香（せんこう、インセンス、incense） は、火をつけることで芳香のある煙を出す、好まれる香りを出す材料を細かくして練り合わせ細い棒状や渦巻き状に成型して乾燥させたものである。
sen.e: The term "Senko (incense stick)" refers to the product which uses, as materials, various substances that emit fragrant smoke and fine aroma when lighted and is produced through the process of grinding materials, kneading, molding into the shape of slender sticks or coils and drying.

The term "Senko (incense stick)" refers to the product which uses, as materials, various substances that emit fragrant smoke and fine aroma when lighted and is produced through the process of grinding materials, kneading, molding into the shape of slender sticks or coils and drying.

The term "Senko (incense stick)" refers to the product which uses, as materials, various substances that emit fragrant smoke and fine aroma when lighted and is produced through the process of grinding materials, kneading, molding into the shape of slender sticks or coils and drying.

sen.j: 香（こう）の一種。
sen.e: Senko is a kind of Ko (incense) products.
Senko is a kind of Ko (incense) products.
Senko is a kind of Ko (incense) products.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 線香は、香の中でも練り合わせて固め棒状としたものであり、「線のように細い」ものが線香と呼ばれうる。
sen.e: Among Ko products, a product which is produced through the process of kneading materials and molding them into a stick and is "slender like a line" is specifically called Senko.
Among Ko products, a product which is produced through the process of kneading materials and molding them into a stick and is "slender like a line" is specifically called Senko.
Among Ko products, a product which is produced through the process of kneading materials and molding them into a stick and is "slender like a line" is specifically called Senko.

sen.j: 香の中には練香と呼ばれる丸薬状の香もあるが、線香ほどは乾燥させないのが普通である。
sen.e: A kind of Ko products called Renko, whose shape is similar to a pill, is not so dried as the case of Senko.
A kind of Ko products called Renko, with a shape similar to a pill, is not so dried as in the case of Senko.
A kind of Ko products called Renko, with a shape similar to a pill, is not so dried as in the case of Senko.

sen.j: 細く長くさせたのは燃焼時間を伸ばし香りの発生を一定とするためである。
sen.e: The reason why it's shape is fine and long is to make burning time longer and stabilize the emission of aroma.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The reason why it's shape is fine and long is to make the burning time longer and stabilize the emission of the aroma.
The reason why its shape is fine and long is to make the burning time longer and stabilize the emission of the aroma.

sen.j: また燃焼が安定していることから扱い易い。
sen.e: Also, it is easier to handle since burning is stable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Also, it is easier to handle since burning is stable.
Also, it is easier to handle since burning is stable.

sen.j: 燃焼時間を延長させる意図で渦巻状の線香もある．
sen.e: Coil-shaped Senko which was developed with the aim of extending burning time is also seen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Coil-shaped Senko which was developed with the aim of extending burning time is also seen.
Coil-shaped Senko which was developed with the aim of extending burning time is also seen.

sen.j: これは香りを楽しむものと蚊取り線香（→蚊遣器）のような実利的な燃焼時間延長のためのものが見られる。
sen.e: Coil-shaped Senko is divided into those developed for the purpose of enjoying aroma and those developed for meeting practical need for extending burning time, such as mosquito repellent Senko (=>Kayariki (mosquito repellent Senko holder)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Coil-shaped Senko is divided into those developed for the purpose of enjoying aroma and those developed for meeting practical need for extending burning time, such as mosquito repellent Senko (=>Kayariki (mosquito repellent Senko holder)).

Coil-shaped Senko is divided into those developed for the purpose of enjoying aroma and those developed for meeting practical need for extending burning time, such as mosquito repellent Senko (=>Kayariki [mosquito repellent Senko holder]).

sen.j: 日本では墓や仏壇に供物として燻らせたりする用法が一般的である。
sen.e: In Japan, Senko is generally used as the altarage for graves or Buddhist altars.
In Japan, Senko is generally used as the altarage for graves or Buddhist altars.
In Japan, Senko is generally used as the altarage for graves or Buddhist altars.

sen.j: 日本に伝来した時期ははっきりしないが、一般に用いられるようになったのは江戸時代以降である。
sen.e: Though it is not clear when Senko was introduced into Japan, it was the Edo period when Senko became prevalent among ordinary people.
Though it is not clear when Senko was introduced into Japan, it was the Edo period when Senko became prevalent among ordinary people.
Though it is not clear when Senko was introduced into Japan, it was the Edo period when Senko became prevalent among ordinary people.

sen.j: 最近では花の香りや香水調などさまざまな香りをもつ新しい線香も増えており、部屋のにおい消しや芳香剤・癒しとしての使用法も増えている。
sen.e: In recent years, Senko is also used in a room as the deodorant or aromatic as well as for the purpose of healing since Senko with floral scents or perfume scents have been invented.
In recent years, Senko is also used in a room as the deodorant or aromatic as well as for the purpose of healing since Senko with floral scents or perfume scents have been invented.
In recent years, Senko is also used in a room as the deodorant or aromatic as well as for the purpose of healing since Senko with floral scents or perfume scents have been introduced.

sen.j: また、江戸時代では時計の代わりとしても使用された。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Senko was also used as the substitute for a clock.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In the Edo period, Senko was also used as the substitute for a clock.
In the Edo period, Senko was also used as the substitute for a clock.

sen.j: 禅寺では線香が1本燃え尽きるまでの時間（40分）を一炷（いっちゅう）と呼び、坐禅を行う時間の単位とした．
sen.e: At Zen-sect temples, time consumed until a stick of Senko burns out (about 40 minutes) was called Icchu and it was used as the unit time of Zen meditation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: At Zen-sect temples, time consumed until a stick of Senko burns out (about 40 minutes) was called Icchu and it was used as the unit time for Zen meditation.
At Zen-sect temples, time consumed until a stick of Senko burns out (about 40 minutes) was called Icchu and it was used as the unit time for Zen meditation.

sen.j: 遊郭では1回の遊びの時間をやはり線香の燃え尽きる時間を基準として計ったが、中には線香を途中で折って時間を短縮させる遊女もいた。
sen.e: Similarly, burning time of a stick of Senko was used at licensed quarters as the standard time of an amusement, but some prostitutes intentionally snapped Senko while burning and shortened the time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Similarly, the burning duration of a stick of Senko was used at licensed quarters as the standard of time for an amusement, but some prostitutes intentionally snapped Senko while burning and shortened the time.

Similarly, the burning duration of a stick of Senko was used at licensed quarters as the standard of time for an amusement, but some prostitutes intentionally snapped Senko while burning and shortened the time.

sen.j: 材料による種類
sen.e: Categorization based on materials
Categorization based on materials
Categorization based on materials

sen.j: 線香は材料から「匂い線香」と「杉線香」に大別される。
sen.e: Senko is categorized into "aromatic Senko" and "cedar Senko" according to respective materials.
Senko is categorized into "aromatic Senko" and "cedar Senko" according to respective materials it's made of.
Senko is categorized into "aromatic Senko" and "cedar Senko" according to respective materials it's made of.

sen.j: 匂い線香
sen.e: Aromatic Senko
Aromatic Senko
Aromatic Senko

sen.j: 匂い線香は、椨（タブノキ）の木の樹皮を粉末にしたものに、ビャクダン（びゃくだん）や香木伽羅（きゃら）といった香木の粉末や他の香料、炭の粉末、その他の材料を加えて練り、線状に成型・乾燥させたもの。
sen.e: Aromatic Senko is the product which uses, as materials, powdered bark of Machilus thunbergi together with the powder of fragrant woods such as sandal tree and agalloch, other perfumes, charcoal powder and other materials and is produced through the process of kneading, molding into the shape of stick and drying.

Aromatic Senko is the product which is made of powdered bark of Machilus thunbergi together with the powder of fragrant woods such as the sandal tree and agalloch, other perfumes, charcoal powder and other materials and is produced through the process of kneading, molding into the shape of stick and then drying.

Aromatic Senko is the product which is made of powdered bark of Machilus thunbergi together with the powder of fragrant woods such as the sandal tree and agalloch, other perfumes, charcoal powder and other materials and is produced through the process of kneading, molding into the shape of stick and then drying.

sen.j: 杉線香
sen.e: Cedar Senko
Cedar Senko
Cedar Senko

sen.j: 杉線香は、3ヶ月ほど乾燥させたスギの葉を粉砕機や水車を用いて粉末にしたものに湯とノリを加えて練り、線状に成型・乾燥させたもの。
sen.e: Cedar Senko is the product which uses, as materials, cedar leaves that were powdered by a crusher or a water mill after drying for about three months and is produced through the process of kneading with hot water and paste added, molding and drying.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Cedar Senko is the product which uses, as materials, cedar leaves that were powdered by a crusher or a water mill after drying for about three months and is produced through the process of kneading with hot water and paste added, molding and drying.

Cedar Senko is the product which uses, as materials, cedar leaves that were powdered by a crusher or a water mill after drying for about three months and is produced through the process of kneading with hot water and paste added, molding and drying.

sen.j: 墓のときなどに特に用いられる。
sen.e: Cedar Senko is used when visiting graves.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Cedar Senko is used when visiting graves.
Cedar Senko is used when visiting graves.

sen.j: 形状による種類
sen.e: Categorization based on shapes
Categorization based on shapes
Categorization based on shapes

sen.j: 線香は形状から、一般的な棒状の線香（中国語 綫條香」の他に、渦巻き線香、竹ひご線香がある。
sen.e: Based on their shape, Senko is categorized into commonly-used stick-shaped Senko (綫條香 in Chinese), coil-shaped Senko and bamboo Senko.
Based on their shape, Senko is categorized into commonly-used stick-shaped Senko (綫條香 in Chinese), coil-shaped Senko and bamboo Senko.
Based on their shape, Senko is categorized into commonly-used stick-shaped Senko (綫條香 in Chinese), coil-shaped Senko and bamboo Senko.

sen.j: また、線香とは呼ばないが、同じ原料で作る円錐形（コーン）型のインセンスがある。
sen.e: Further, though it is not called Senko, there exists a kind of incense whose shape is conic (cone) that is produced from the same materials.
Further, though it is not called Senko, there exists a kind of incense with a conic (cone) shape that is produced from the same materials.
Further, though it is not called Senko, there exists a kind of incense with a conic (cone) shape that is produced from the same materials.

sen.j: 渦巻き線香
sen.e: Coil-shaped Senko
Coil-shaped Senko
Coil-shaped Senko

sen.j: 香港、台湾などでは、中国語で「盤状香」と呼ばれる渦巻き型の線香を寺院に吊して祈願することがよく行われている。
sen.e: In Hong Kong and Taiwan, people often pray with coil-shaped Senko, which is called "盤状香 " in Chinese, hunging at temples.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In Hong Kong and Taiwan, people often pray with coil-shaped Senko, which is called "盤状香 " in Chinese, hunging at temples.
In Hong Kong and Taiwan, people often pray with coil-shaped Senko, which is called "盤状香 " in Chinese, hanging at temples.

sen.j: 大型のものでは、連続ひと月近くも燃え続ける例がある。
sen.e: Some large-sized ones continue to burn for nearly one month.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Some large-sized ones continue to burn for nearly one month.
Some large-sized ones continue to burn for nearly one month.

sen.j: 太く長い棒状によったものを巻き付けて作り、渦巻き状に打ち抜く蚊取り線香とは成形方法が異なる。
sen.e: As it is molded by winding thick and long sticks, its molding method is different from that of mosquito coil which is molded by the use of extruder.
As it is molded by winding thick and long sticks, its molding method is different from that of mosquito coil which is molded by the use of an extruder.
As it is molded by winding thick and long sticks, its molding method is different from that of mosquito coil which is stamped in the shape of coil.
sen.cmt: molded by the use of an extruder→stamped in the shape of coil と修正しました。

sen.j: 日本では、葬儀の一環（通夜など）に香を絶やさないためとして、この渦巻き線香が利用される場合もある。
sen.e: In Japan, coil-shaped Senko is sometimes used in order to keep incense burning throughout funeral (vigil etc.).
In Japan, coil-shaped Senko is sometimes used in order to keep incense burning throughout a funeral (vigil etc.).
In Japan, coil-shaped Senko is sometimes used in order to keep incense burning throughout a funeral (vigil etc.).

sen.j: 元々は通夜に際して親族や関係者が交代で夜通し香を捧げる弔問の客などに応対したことに由来する。
sen.e: The origin of the above was the fact that relatives and other related persons used to keep vigil in turn in order to address persons calling to express condolence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The origin of the above was the fact that relatives and other related persons used to keep vigil in turn in order to address persons calling to express condolence.
The origin of the above was the fact that relatives and other related persons used to keep vigil in turn in order to address persons calling to express condolence.

sen.j: 近年では夜通し弔問を受ける風習が廃れ、灯明（ろうそく）と線香を絶やさないようにすることだと冠婚葬祭業者が説明することもあり、関係者就寝中にも焚き続けるために利用される。
sen.e: Although such practice has declined recently, undertakers often recommend to keep candles and incense burning throughout a night and this type of Senko is used for the purpose of keeping incense burning while related persons are sleeping.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although such practice has declined recently, undertakers often recommend to keep candles and incense burning throughout a night and this type of Senko is used for the purpose of keeping incense burning while related persons are sleeping.

Although such practice has declined recently, undertakers often recommend to keep candles and incense burning throughout the night and this type of Senko is used for the purpose of keeping incense burning while people concerned are sleeping.
sen.cmt: a→the,関係者： people concerned として修正しました。

sen.j: 一巻が約8～12時間ほど掛けてゆっくりと燃焼する。
sen.e: Coil-shaped Senko burns slowly and it takes about 8 to 12 hours for a piece of coil-shaped Senko to burn out.
Coil-shaped Senko burns slowly and it takes about 8 to 12 hours for a piece of coil-shaped Senko to burn out.
Coil-shaped Senko burns slowly and it takes about 8 to 12 hours for a piece of coil-shaped Senko to burn out.

sen.j: ただし現代住宅の場合は家屋の密閉性が高いため、換気をしないと線香でいぶされることもある。
sen.e: As contemporary houses are airtight, ventilation is required from time to time in order to avoid being smoked by Senko.
As contemporary houses are airtight, ventilation is required from time to time in order to avoid being smoked by Senko.
As contemporary houses are airtight, ventilation is required from time to time in order to avoid being smoked by Senko.

sen.j: 竹ひご線香
sen.e: Banboo Senko
Banboo Senko
Bamboo stick Senko
sen.cmt: 竹ひご：bamboo stick として修正しました。

sen.j: インドや中華人民共和国、台湾などでは、細い竹ひごに線香の生地を練りつけて固めた竹芯香、（竹ひご線香、中国語 竹枝香）が古くから用いられている。
sen.e: In India, People's Republic of China and Taiwan, bamboo Senko (竹枝香 in Chinese), which is produced by attaching wet Senko around shaved bamboo, has been used from long ago.
In India, People's Republic of China and Taiwan, bamboo Senko (竹枝香 in Chinese), which is produced by attaching wet Senko around shaved bamboo, has been used from long ago.
In India, People's Republic of China and Taiwan, bamboo stick Senko (竹枝香 in Chinese), which is produced by attaching wet Senko around shaved bamboo, has been used from long ago.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正,bamboo Senko→bamboo stick Senko

sen.j: 日本でも輸入雑貨店などでよく販売されている。
sen.e: It is often on sale at import shops in Japan.
It is often on sale at import shops in Japan.
It is often on sale at import shops in Japan.

sen.j: この竹芯香の製法が天正に日本に伝わり、現代の日本の線香の原型になったとされる。
sen.e: Its production tecnique was imported into Japan in the Tensho era and became the origin of current Japanese Senko.
Its production tecnique was imported into Japan in the Tensho era and became the origin of current Japanese Senko.
Its production technique was imported into Japan in the Tensho era and became the origin of current Japanese Senko.

sen.j: 折れ難いという利点があり、中国ではこれを大きく振り回して周囲に香りを広げる動作も見られる。
sen.e: The advantage of this type of Senko is toughness and in China, people often swing it so that aroma spread out.
The advantage of this type of Senko is toughness and in China, people often swing it so that aroma spreads out.
The advantage of this type of Senko is toughness and in China, people often swing it so that aroma spreads out.

sen.j: 日本では玩具店や駄菓子屋で扱われ、花火の点火用など本来の用途ではない利用のされ方をすることもある。
sen.e: In Japan, it is also on sale at toy shops and/or mom-and-pop candy stores and sometimes used for other purposes, such as lighting fireworks. than the primary purpose.
In Japan, it is also on sale at toy shops and/or mom-and-pop candy stores and sometimes used for other purposes, such as lighting fireworks. than the primary purpose.
In Japan, it is also on sale at toy shops and/or mom-and-pop candy stores and sometimes used for other purposes than the primary purpose, such as lighting fireworks.
sen.cmt: than the primary purpose を移動し、修正しました。

sen.j: 束線香
sen.e: Bundled Senko
Bundled Senko
Bundled Senko

sen.j: 束にしてある線香で、多くは紙に巻かれる。
sen.e: Bundled Senko means Senko bundled usually by paper.
Bundled Senko means Senko bundled usually with paper.
Bundled Senko means Senko bundled usually with paper.

sen.j: 墓参用の線香で戸外で使うため野線香とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: As this type of Senko is used when visiting graves, it is also called Yasenko (field Senko) because it is used outdoors.
As this type of Senko is used when visiting graves, it is also called Yasenko (field Senko) because it is used outdoors.
As this type of Senko is used when visiting graves, it is also called Yasenko (field Senko) because it is used outdoors.

sen.j: 点火に際しては束を解いて扇状に広げてろうそくなどの火であぶる。
sen.e: When using, we cut a bundle, hold sticks in fan-like fashion and light them by a candle etc.
When using, we cut a bundle, hold sticks in fan-like fashion and light them with a candle etc.
When lighting, untie a bundle, hold sticks in fan-like fashion and ignite them with a candle etc.
sen.cmt: using→lighting,we cut→untie,light→ignite と修正しました。

sen.j: 点火して後に親族間で束を分け、それぞれが焼香台に添える場合もある。
sen.e: We sometimes distribute bundles that were already lighted to relatives and each of them put such bundleed Senko on the incense table.
We sometimes distribute bundles that were already lit to relatives and each of them put such bundleed Senko on the incense table.
There is also a case: a bundle is divided into small chunks and given to relatives after it's ignited, then each of them present the Senko on the incense stand.
sen.cmt: 原文より全体を修正しました。

sen.j: なお近代化された住宅内で使用される線香では冷暖房の効率を挙げる上で建物の気密性が高いため、香りが穏やかで煙の少ないものが主流である。
sen.e: As modern houses are designed to maintain air tightness in order to improve the efficiency of air-conditioners, Senko which emits less aroma is mainly used inside houses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As modern houses are designed to maintain air tightness in order to improve the efficiency of air-conditioners, Senko which emits less aroma is mainly used inside houses.
As modern houses are designed to maintain air tightness in order to improve the efficiency of air-conditioners, Senko which emits less aroma and smoke is mainly used inside houses.
sen.cmt: and smoke を挿入しました。

sen.j: これに対して、戸外で使うものでは煙と香りが強い製品が主流である。
sen.e: By contrast, Senko which emits more smoke and aroma is mainly used outdoors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: By contrast, Senko which emits more smoke and aroma is mainly used outdoors.
By contrast, Senko which emits more smoke and aroma is mainly used outdoors.

sen.j: 衛生線香
sen.e: Sanitary Senko
Sanitary Senko
Sanitary Senko

sen.j: 中国では芳香及び駆虫目的で、公衆便所などで「衛生香」と呼ばれる、太い棒状や渦巻き型の線香を焚く例が少なくない。
sen.e: In China, Senko of fat stick shape or coil-shaped Senko, both are called "衛生香", is often used at public restrooms for the purpose of emitting aroma and getting rid of noxious insects.
In China, Senko of a fat stick shape or coil-shaped Senko, both are called "衛生香," is often used at public restrooms for the purpose of emitting aroma and getting rid of noxious insects.

In China, Senko of a fat stick shape or coil-shaped Senko, both are called "衛生香 (fragrant incense)," is often used at public restrooms for the purpose of emitting aroma and getting rid of noxious insects.
sen.cmt: 衛生香：fragrant incense として挿入しました。参考URL(http://www.kejiyingyu.com/search.php?dictkeyword=fragrant-flowered+garlic)

sen.j: 殺虫目的の蚊取り線香とは異なる。
sen.e: It is different from mosquito repellent Senko whose purpose is killing mosquitoes.
It is different from mosquito repellent Senko used for killing mosquitoes.
It is different from mosquito repellent Senko used for killing mosquitoes.

sen.j: 一般的な製法
sen.e: General production process
General production process
General production process

sen.j: 以下、棒状の「匂い線香」を例にとって製法を解説する。
sen.e: The followings are the production process of "aromatic Senko" in the shape of stick.
The following are the production process of "aromatic Senko" in the shape of a stick.
The following are the production process of "aromatic Senko" in the shape of a stick.

sen.j: 椨（タブ）などの木を粉末にしたものに、香木の粉末や香料を加えて均一になるまで撹拌し、更に湯を加えて練る。
sen.e: Whip powdered bark of Machilus thunbergi thoroughly together with the powders of fragrant woods and other perfumes, add hot water and knead.
Whip powdered bark of Machilus thunbergi thoroughly together with the powders of fragrant woods and other perfumes, add hot water and knead.
Whip powdered bark of Machilus thunbergi thoroughly together with the powders of fragrant woods and other perfumes, add hot water and knead.

sen.j: 出来上がった粘土状のもの（練り玉）を専用の押し出し器で押し出し、一定の太さの棒状に成型する。
sen.e: Mold clay-like thing (neridama) into sticks with same thickness with the use of extruders for exclusive use.
Mold clay-like material (neridama) into sticks with same thickness as what extruders produce for exclusive use.
Mold clay-like material (neridama) into sticks with same thickness as what extruders produce for exclusive use.

sen.j: 木の板（盆板）にとり、乾燥用の板（干し板）に移し変える。
sen.e: Put them on wooden boards (tray boards) and remove them to the boards for drying (drying boards).
Put them on wooden boards (tray boards) and take them to the boards for drying (drying boards).
Put them on wooden boards (tray boards) and take them to the boards for drying (drying boards).

sen.j: 干し板上にきっちり並べた線香を、規定の長さに切りそろえる。
sen.e: Line them up on drying boards in order and cut them in equal length.
Line them up on drying boards in order and cut them into equal lengths.
Line them up on drying boards in order and cut them into equal lengths.

sen.j: 一週間から10日間乾燥させた後、箱詰め包装される。
sen.e: Dry them for a week to 10 days and pack them in boxes.
Dry them for a week to 10 days and pack them in boxes.
Dry them for a week to 10 days and pack them in boxes.

sen.j: 淡路市（旧・津名郡一宮町 (兵庫県津名郡)、兵庫県）

sen.j: 嘉永三年（1850年）に堺の技術を導入し製造が始まる。
sen.e: Its production commenced in 1850 with introducing the technique of Sakai.
Production commenced in 1850 introducing the Sakai technique.
Production commenced in 1850 introducing the Sakai technique.

sen.j: 昭和30年代半ばには線香生産量日本一となり、現在では全国生産量のうち、70％を占めている。
sen.e: Its Output of Senko became the largest in Japan in mid thirties of Showa era and current output accounts for 70 % of total output in Japan.
Its Output of Senko became the largest in Japan during the mid thirties of the Showa era and current output accounts for 70% of total output in Japan.
Its Output of Senko became the largest in Japan during the mid thirties of the Showa era and current output accounts for 70% of total output in Japan.

sen.j: 日光市（栃木県）
sen.e: Nikko City
Nikko City
Nikko City (Tochigi Prefecture)

sen.j: 杉が日本全国に植林される前から続く日光杉並木に代表される杉のメッカであり、杉線香の生産量は日本一である
sen.e: The city has been famous for the line of cedar trees called Nikko Suginamiki even before cedar trees were planted around the nation and its output of Cedar Senko is the largest in Japan.
The city has been famous for cedar trees called Nikko Suginamiki even before cedar trees were planted around the nation and its output of Cedar Senko is the largest in Japan.
The city has been famous for cedar trees called Nikko Suginamiki even before cedar trees were planted around the nation and its output of Cedar Senko is the largest in Japan.

sen.j: 京都府
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 文化的背景に裏付けられた商品力により、生産量対生産額比では日本一の高付加価値製品産地である。
sen.e: Thanks to the commercial value of products supported by the cultural background, its output of high value-added products, in terms of the proportion of production volume versus production value, is the largest in Japan.

Thanks to the commercial value of products supported by the cultural background, its output of high value-added products, in terms of the proportion of production volume versus production value, is the largest in Japan.

Thanks to the commercial value of products supported by the cultural background, its output of high value-added products, in terms of the proportion of production volume versus production value, is the largest in Japan.

sen.j: 堺市（大阪府）
sen.e: Sakai City (Osaka Prefecture)
Sakai City (Osaka Prefecture)
Sakai City (Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 天正年間（1573～92年）に、堺の薬種商人が渡韓し線香の製法を導入製造したのが、日本最古の線香とされている。
sen.e: It is believed that Japanese Senko production was originated by a medicine merchant of Sakai who visited Korea in the Tensho era (1573 - 1592), introduced the production technique and started production.

It is believed that Japanese Senko production was originated by a medicine merchant of Sakai who visited Korea during the Tensho era (1573 - 1592), and introduced the production technique and started production.

It is believed that Japanese Senko production was originated by a medicine merchant of Sakai who visited Korea during the Tensho era (1573 - 1592), and introduced the production technique and started production.

sen.j: 戦前には全国生産量の約60％を占めていた。
sen.e: Its output accounted for about 60 % of Japan's total during pre-war period.
Its output accounted for about 60% of Japan's total during pre-war period.
Its output accounted for about 60% of Japan's total during pre-war period.

sen.j: 国内生産状況
sen.e: The status of production in Japan
The status of production in Japan
The status of production in Japan

sen.j: 平成18年の全国生産量・額は、7,315トン・313億円である。
sen.e: Nationwide production volume and production value in 2006 was 7,315 tons and 31.3 billion yen respectively.
Nationwide production volume and production value in 2006 was 7,315 tons and 31.3 billion yen respectively.
Nationwide production volume and production value in 2006 was 7,315 tons and 31.3 billion yen respectively.

sen.j: （工業統計表・品目編）生産量で平成7年に10,859トン、生産額では9年の351億円をピークとして、その後は減少傾向である。
sen.e: (Industrial statistics • individual item section) Both production volume and production value peaked in 1995 at 10,859 tons and 35.1 billion yen respectively and has been declined since then.
(Industrial statistics • individual item section) Both production volume and production value peaked in 1995 at 10,859 tons and 35.1 billion yen respectively and has been decling since then.

(Industrial statistics • individual item section) Both production volume and production value peaked in 1995 at 10,859 tons and 35.1 billion yen in 1997 respectively and has been declining since then.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正、”9年”を挿入しました。decling→declining

sen.j: 大手メーカーはすでに生産拠点を海外に移しているところもある。
sen.e: Some of big producers have already shifted their production bases to abroad.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Some of big producers have already shifted their production bases abroad.
Some of big producers have already shifted their production bases abroad.

sen.j: それらを含め、中国、マレーシア、台湾、インド、タイ、ベトナム、インドネシア等海外からの輸入量はすでに国内生産量の半分に達しているとみられている。
sen.e: It is contemplated that the volume of products imported from China, Malaysia, Taiwan, India, Vietnam and Indonesia, including those produced at Japanese owned company, is equivalent to nearly a half of domestically produced products.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It is contemplated that the volume of products imported from China, Malaysia, Taiwan, India, Vietnam and Indonesia, including those produced at Japanese owned companies, is equivalent to nearly a half of domestically produced products.

It is assumed that the volume of products imported from China, Malaysia, Taiwan, India, Vietnam, Thailand and Indonesia, including those produced at Japanese owned companies, is equivalent to nearly a half of domestically produced products.

sen.j: 関東地方では安価な墓参用線香の需要の内すでに7～80％が輸入品が占めている。
sen.e: In Kanto region, import products account for 70% to 80% of the market of cheap Senko used for grave visit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In the Kanto region, imported products account for 70% to 80% of the market of cheap Senko used for grave visits.
In the Kanto region, imported products account for 70% to 80% of the market of cheap Senko used for grave visits.

sen.j: 有力生産地の一つである栃木では、輸入品と競合するメーカーは廃業に至ることが多い。
sen.e: In Tochigi Prefecture, one of principal production center, many producers whose products are in competition with import products were forced to cease business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In Tochigi Prefecture, one of principal production centers, many producers whose products are in competition with imported products were forced to cease business.
In Tochigi Prefecture, one of principal production centers, many producers whose products are in competition with imported products were forced to cease business.

sen.j: 高級品に関しては今のところ海外製は品質が劣るため影響は少ない。
sen.e: By contrast, high-grade products have not been affected so much since the quality of import products is inferior.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: By contrast, high-grade products have not been affected so much since the quality of import products is inferior.
By contrast, high-grade products have not been affected so much since the quality of import products is inferior.

sen.j: 市場では中級品、高級品は国内品、普及品は輸入品と、すみ分けが進んでいる。
sen.e: Domestic market has been increasingly divided into the market of middle-grade and high-grade products in which domestic products are prevailing and that of low-grade products in which import products are preveiling.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Domestic market has been increasingly divided into a market of middle-grade and high-grade products in which domestic products are prevailing and that of low-grade products in which import products are prevailing.

Domestic market has been increasingly divided into a market of middle-grade and high-grade products in which domestic products are prevailing and that of low-grade products in which import products are prevailing.

sen.j: 輸出は、量は少ないものの、アメリカ、韓国、シンガポール、ヨーロッパなどへとされている。
sen.e: A small quantity of products are exported to the U.S, Korea, Singapore and Europe.
A small quantity of products are exported to the U.S, Korea, Singapore, and Europe.
A small quantity of products are exported to the U.S, Korea, Singapore, and Europe.

sen.j: 特にドイツは「禅」がブームとなっており、需要が増加している。
sen.e: Demand for Senko is increasing in Germany where "Zen" is booming.
Demand for Senko is increasing in Germany where "Zen" is booming.
In particular, demand for Senko is increasing in Germany where "Zen" is booming.
sen.cmt: In particular, を挿入しました。
